definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Now he felt the cool breeze that was blowing in this part of the Maze and it was refreshing.
sentences.chinese: 这时，从迷宫中吹来习习的凉风，使人感到神清气爽。

sentences.english: Refreshing and stimulating, it wakes you up with a pleasure of enjoyng the rich, heady taste.
sentences.chinese: 浓郁醇厚的味道，让你神清气爽，精力充沛。

sentences.english: Chrysanthemum from Huangshan Moutain brings you a refreshed day.
sentences.chinese: 黄山的精品菊花，给你带来一天的神清气爽。

sentences.english: When you awaken from REM sleep, you’ll feel refreshed and alert.
sentences.chinese: 当你从眼动睡眠中被唤醒的话，你会感觉到神清气爽。

sentences.english: You will feel better and save money.
sentences.chinese: 你会觉得更神清气爽，而且很省钱。

sentences.english: White desk and bookcase, qing Dynasty of god making a person enrages bright.
sentences.chinese: 白色的书桌和书柜，令人神清气爽。

sentences.english: Autumn. The air is light and summer`s humid heat is fading.
sentences.chinese: 秋天，空气使人神清气爽，夏季的湿热正渐渐退去。

sentences.english: When he was refreshed with food and sleep, he contemplated his journey again.
sentences.chinese: 当他吃饱睡够，神清气爽，便可以再考虑他的行程。

definition: in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
lit. vitality a hundredfold (idiom); refreshed/one's vigor thoroughly restored
lit. heart untroubled, spirit pleased (idiom); carefree and relaxed
spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
in great spirits/to have great vitality
in glowing spirits (idiom); bursting with life/radiating health and vigor
to penetrate deeply into the heart (idiom)/to gladden the heart/to refresh the mind
to rouse/to invigorate/to enliven/to put sb into high spirits/con brio
